title: Eve Online
notes: Followed the same instructions in an entry below https://gist.github.com/thomas-lange/520ebeb899666f6f0354915b7b934582, yet I found when set to XP it was a stutter fest, set to Win 7 still stutters however a lot smoother. AA doesn't seem to hold the setting. Odd graphical glitches but not too common. Playable not perfect.

title: OS: Ubuntu 18.04.1 LTS x86_64 (Kernel: 4.15.0-33-generic)
notes:
Error: Tray Icon pops up for about 1-2 seconds and it crashes

Workaround: Download via steam, install winetricks and use winetricks to install corefonts, d3dx9_36, vcrun2005, vcrun2008, vcrun2010. Run winecfg and select -> Libraries -> [New override for library: ] d3d11 -> Add -> Edit... -> Disable. Run winecfg and select -> Windows Version: Windows XP. Launch game via Steam

Error: When launched, launcher opens. But it is completely gray. In the top right corner, a close, minimize and settings buttons can be seen. I played a around in the setting but to no avail (for me at least)

gpu: X.Org Radeon RX Vega (VEGA10, DRM 3.23.0, 4.15.0-33-generic, LLVM 6.0.0)
notes: Needed to install winetricks to install corefonts, vcrun2005, vcrun2008 and vcrun2010; winecfg set to Windows XP but this might not have been necessary. Gameplay (traveling through trade hubs) was smooth, but the mouse cursor flickers.
title: EVE Online

gpu: Intel Open Source Technology Center Mesa DRI Intel(R) HD Graphics 520 (Skylake GT2) x86/MMX/SSE2
notes: Shows Running for a couple seconds, then crashed without any visual feedback. Intel HD 520 graphics on a Thinkpad x260.
title: EVE Online

notes: After tweaking it a bit with what i found on this list it works. Thought the menu that has your accounts is a bit buggy and slow.
title: EVE Online

notes: Needed to install corefonts vcrun2005 vcrun2008 vcrun2010 with winetricks for the launcher, and use winecfg to set  Windows XP compatibility mode. Once in-game, works perfectly.
title: EVE Online

notes: Not installed and played via Steam. There's a native launcher. Installed using: https://wiki.eveuniversity.org/Installing_EVE_on_Linux | After first start a reasonable resolution had to be set. Mouse was offset so it was a bit difficult. After that it runs very good. Even with three clients in parallel.
title: EVE Online
